text: [Music]
hey everybody Thomas Joseph here now
Apple pumpkin and pecan pies are the
most popular pies for Thanksgiving but
that doesn't mean year after year they
have to look the same today I'm going to
show you five creative ways in which you
can embellish your Thanksgiving pies and
we're going to get started right now
with a leaf boarder and this is for a
single crust pie so that's like your
pumpkin pie or your pecan pie take these
little cookie cutters and I'm using leaf
shapes today and dip the cutters in a
little bit of flour and all you're going
to do is cut out with some more pie
dough your favorite shapes and using a
little bit of egg wash and a small brush
apply to the back of your leaf in this
case gently press them into the lip or
rim or edge of your pie plate creating a
leaf boarder I like to overlap the
leaves a little bit but basically you
repeat this process until you have a
beautiful border and then you're ready
to put it into the refrigerator and then
blind-bake it and now for another way to
embellish the crust or edge of your
single crust pie is the braid a braid is
really easy don't get intimidated by
this I have a ruler and I have one of
these things as a pastry wheel and cut
three strips so now it's attached them
all at the end and then taking the dough
on the outside bringing it into the
center and continuing the process I like
to attach the braided edge in two pieces
brush the edge with egg wash the egg
wash I'm using today is a whole egg with
a little bit of heavy cream and take
your braids and attach it to the edge
and you're going to repeat the process
with another piece of braid and what I
like to do is I like to cover up the
seams wherever you've attached two
braids with some leaves and now for one
of my favorite things and that is
the negative space so this is for a
double crust pie and this is what I call
a honeycomb top to a pie where you're
cutting out circles so I have a circle
cutter you could use a pastry tip you
could use an apple corer use a little
bit of flour and all you have to do is
cut out little circles and this is
perfect for your apple pie any other
filled pie this would totally work and
all you do is pick up your crust place
it right over the filling and press this
top crust into the bottom crust and
there you go you have a beautiful
honeycomb top for your double crust pie
and now for another way to embellish
your pie a lattice top you can mix it up
and do a thin in a thick lattice or you
could do thick strips arrange your
strips over the top so I'm going to do
three this way and then I'm going to do
three strips the other way an easy way
once you've started it is you can start
flipping the dough up just like this fit
in another piece of dough bring these
guys down pull this one up with this one
on top and then press down to seal the
top crust into the bottom crust get this
right into the refrigerator and chill it
until it's set and firm before baking it
and there you go a perfect wide lattice
top so now for the final way to
embellish your pie and that is giving a
decorative covering to the entire pie
itself I'm using a fluted round cutter
and give each one a little bit of a
brush with egg wash on the bottom side
and what you're going to do is overlap
all of your cutouts covering the entire
top of the pie so the last little round
here you can see how great that is now
of course leave a little room in the
center a little hole so that some of the
steam can escape from the apples get all
of these into the refrigerator before
baking in a hot hot oven and make sure
your double crust pies you brush them
with egg wash you can even sprinkle them
with some sanding sugar and I encourage
you to get creative this
Thanksgiving season and try some of
these awesome embellishments for your
Thanksgiving pie enjoy guys
you
[Music]
